profile.headline: Together, let's develop innovative solutions
profile.intro1: I am Morgan. Passionate and curious about software engineering, I strive to design well-architected, scalable, and maintainable solutions.
profile.intro2: My goal is to create truly useful applications designed with the real needs of users in mind, and built to be modifiable and adaptable over time.
profile.intro3: With a Master's degree in Software Engineering from the University of Montpellier, I maintained a strong academic record thanks to my dedication, rigor, and curiosity. My early professional experiences quickly strengthened my technical skills and shaped a practical and hands-on approach to the profession.

dolobox.title: Student Project - Dolobox
dolobox.desc1: This project was carried out as part of my training, in collaboration with the ERIOS team at Montpellier University Hospital. It is a prototype for connected pain monitoring of patients.
dolobox.desc2: Led with my teammates Romain Gallerne and Richard Picole-Ollivier, this project was a rich experience both technically and personally.
dolobox.desc3: It showcases my skills in software development and research. A feasibility study was conducted to better understand technical needs, patient expectations (end users), and the hospital environment.
dolobox.desc4: We organized discussions with hospital nurses to gather concrete feedback from the field. This guided our solution design and technical choices.
dolobox.desc5: Alongside the physical device, we developed a web app to visualize data in real time.

dkapp.title: Danbee Korean
dkapp.desc1: This project was born from a simple request: to create an online learning platform for someone wanting to teach Korean. But behind this request was a much more personal journey, driven by my desire to go beyond mere technical execution.
dkapp.desc2: Rather than just following a specification, I sought to understand the context, usages, and real expectations. I developed the web app in React with Next.js and a Node.js REST API with Express, but that's not what sets me apart.
dkapp.desc3: This project pushed me to explore, experiment, and learn differently. For example, I turned an old PC into a personal Debian server, which wasn't planned but became central to my ecosystem.
dkapp.desc4: I love building my own tools, understanding what's behind common solutions, and taking unconventional paths. More than a technical project, Danbee Korean allowed me to cultivate my uniqueness: a handcrafted development approach where curiosity, autonomy, and long-term vision have their place.
